help.name: mris_volmask
help.description: Computes a volume mask, at the same resolution as the <subject>/mri/brain.mgz. The volume mask contains 4 values: LH_WM (default 10), LH_GM (default 100), RH_WM (default 20), RH_GM (default 200). The algorithm uses the 4 surfaces situated in <subject>/surf/[lh|rh].[white|pial].surf and labels voxels based on the signed-distance function from the surface.

optional-flagged.explanation: pars = 1. maximum distance up to which the signed distance function computation is accurate
pars = 1. Override default value for background label value (0)
pars = 1. Override default value for left white matter label - 20
pars = 1. Override default value for left ribbon label - 10
pars = 1. Override default value for right white matter label - 120
pars = 1. Override default value for right ribbon label - 110
pars = 1. Surface root name (i.e. <subject>/surf/$hemi.<NAME> - default value is white
pars = 1. Surface root name (i.e. <subject>/surf/$hemi.<NAME> - default value is pial
pars = 1. Default value is aseg. Allows specifying a different name for the aseg input file.
pars = 1. Default value is ribbon - output will then be mri/ribbon.mgz and mri/lh.ribbon.mgz and mri/rh.ribbon.mgz (last 2 if -save_ribbon is used)
pars = 1. Option to specify SUBJECTS_DIR, default is read from enviro
option to save the signed distance function as ?h.dwhite.mgz ?h.dpial.mgz in the mri directory
option to edit the aseg using the ribbons and save to aseg.ribbon.mgz in the mri directory
option to save just the ribbon for the hemispheres - in the format ?h.ribbon.mgz
